page.title: 17The Old Telephone Exchange
page.content: In June 1985 we visited the Pontypridd exchange.First of all we went to the cable chambers.In one thick cable there are thousands of other cables. There were about ten thick cables there.This exchange was built in 1958,it is out of date now.When we went upstairs we saw big batteries,for use in a power cut.Only eight people work there now,but in the past thirty people worked there.For a local call it costs 5p every three minutes,but if you call abroad it costs 5p every six seconds.They work out how much you need to pay for your bill by using meters which are photographed every three months.They have faults in every 100 calls.All the people who work there work five days a week from 8 till 4.15,a total of thirty-seven and a half hours each week. By Kelvin Dagg of Graig-y-wion school
